English ability.description: the ability description; basically you only need to translate items (abilities, strikes, equipment, …) that don't exist within a compendium - or if you want a standard ability to have additional text (see attack of opportunity below)

Attack of Opportunity.name: Gelegenheitsangriff

some modified attack of opportunity. You only have to add such things if you want an individual text - otherwise the coding uses the one from the bestiary glossary and you don't have to add it at all.

one more ability.name: translated name 2
one more ability.description: A lot of data within the npc sheets is translated using the data within the NPCDictionary - hp details, ac details, senses, speed details, save bonuses, regeneration, lore, skill variant labels, additions to spell names like (At Will),… As your first step you should localize the data found there, then have a look at your npcs and add missing things

strike-a strike.name: translated strike
strike-a strike.description: A lot of npc strikes should already get translated using the data provided within the NPCDictionary. However, if if have something special or a strike with additional description text, you can also add it here as an ability with the prefix

equipment-an equipment.name: translated equipment
equipment-an equipment.description: same es strikes. Most equipment is localized using the equipment compendium. However, some npcs also have special stuff that does not exist in a compendium. If it is something you might use multiple times you can add it to the NPCDictionary, otherwise you can also just add it here

some sense.name: some translated sense
some sense.description: The basic senses as well as basic language entries like telepathy get automaticalls translated. Special senses should be entered here, however
